answers.answer: There is debate whether the terms 'borderline diabetic' or pre-diabetic' are even meaningful. A lot of doctors will tell you, you either are or you aren't. A more meaningful measure of your insulin resisistance is the HOMA test which takes your glucose and insulin into account. There has even been some research showing that the diabetes drug Metformin can help certain sub-groups of HCV patients show better results when treating with IFN. This definitely deserves more research on your part before making any decision on whether to treat and how to approach your treatment. The archives of this site are a good place to start.Good luck.

the truth is out therejust had to do that, Fox, is it?When you are doing your research check out co-morbidity.  There is lots of evidence that it is easier to treat when you you are younger -- that as you age other illnesses present and can make treatment more difficult-- this is the co-morbididty.  If you do indeed have diabetes then it may be harder to clear.  If you are tired all the time, it may be worth the effort to treat.  If you clear you may be less tired, although some people to not regain energy.frijole
